name: HTML/CSS Fundamentals
description: Essential HTML structure and CSS styling concepts

questions.question: What is semantic HTML?
questions.answer: Using HTML elements that clearly describe their meaning (header, nav, article, section, footer)

questions.question: What is the CSS box model?
questions.answer: Content, padding, border, and margin layers that make up the total size of an element

questions.question: What is the difference between inline and block elements?
questions.answer: Block elements take full width and start on new line, inline elements only take needed width

questions.question: What is Flexbox?
questions.answer: A CSS layout model for creating flexible, responsive layouts in one dimension (row or column)

questions.question: What is CSS Grid?
questions.answer: A two-dimensional CSS layout system for creating complex responsive layouts with rows and columns

questions.question: What is the difference between padding and margin?
questions.answer: Padding is space inside the element (between content and border), margin is space outside (around border)

questions.question: What is CSS specificity?
questions.answer: Determines which CSS rule applies when multiple rules target the same element (inline > ID > class > tag)

questions.question: What are CSS media queries?
questions.answer: CSS rules that apply only when certain conditions are met (screen size, orientation, etc.) for responsive design
